org.apache.karaf.shell.api.action

Annotation Type Argument


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface Argument
    Represents a positional argument on a command line (as opposed to an optional named Option

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT 
      static java.lang.String DEFAULT_STRING 

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean censor
      Censor the argument in the console.
      java.lang.String description
      A textual description of the argument.
      int index
      Position of the argument in the command line.
      char mask
      Character to use when censoring the argument in the console.
      boolean multiValued
      The last argument can be multi-valued in which case the field type must be a List.
      java.lang.String name
      Name of the argument.
      boolean required
      Whether this argument is mandatory or not.
      java.lang.String valueToShowInHelp
      The generated help displays default values for arguments.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_STRING

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_STRING

      • DEFAULT

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        Name of the argument. By default, the field name will be used.
        Returns:
        the argument name.
        Default:
        "##default"

      • description

        public abstract java.lang.String description
        A textual description of the argument.
        Returns:
        the argument description.
        Default:
        ""

      • required

        public abstract boolean required
        Whether this argument is mandatory or not.
        Returns:
        true if the argument is required, false else.
        Default:
        false

      • index

        public abstract int index
        Position of the argument in the command line. When using multiple arguments, the indices must be starting from 0 and incrementing without any holes.
        Returns:
        the argument index.
        Default:
        0

      • multiValued

        public abstract boolean multiValued
        The last argument can be multi-valued in which case the field type must be a List.
        Returns:
        true if the argument has multiple values, false else.
        Default:
        false

      • valueToShowInHelp

        public abstract java.lang.String valueToShowInHelp
        The generated help displays default values for arguments. In case the value displayed in the help to the user should be different that the default value of the field, one can use this property to specify the value to display.
        Returns:
        the argument help string representation.
        Default:
        "DEFAULT"

      • censor

        public abstract boolean censor
        Censor the argument in the console. Characters will be replaced with mask(). This is useful for hiding sensitive data like passwords.
        Returns:
        true if the argument should be censored in the console.
        Default:
        false

      • mask

        public abstract char mask
        Character to use when censoring the argument in the console.
        Returns:
        the Character to use when censoring the argument in the console.
        Default:
        42
